question: Is Hirschsprung disease one of the characteristics of the Mowat-Wilson syndrome?
ideal_answer: Mowat-Wilson syndrome is characterized by typical facial features, moderate-to-severe mental retardation, epilepsy and variable congenital malformations, including Hirschsprung disease, genital anomalies, congenital heart disease, agenesis of the corpus callosum, and eye defects.
